name: treatment of garden biowaste, home composting in heaps | biowaste, garden waste | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21659/documentation

This home composting inventory refers to 1 kg of garden biowaste as input. The composter is in heaps. ;The inventory is based on experiments, where 272 kg of garden waste were used. ;The experience lasted 1 year.;178 kg of compost were produced.; The composition of garden waste and compost are in the report in french "Impact sanitaire et environnementaux du compostage domestique - rapport, ADEME, 2015" (page 91). The description of the experience is on page 76 : https://www.ademe.fr/sites/default/files/assets/documents/impact-sanitaire-environnemental-compostage-domestique-201512-rapport-final-partiea.pdf. ;;The composter was stirred quarterly (at the time of sampling campaigns). 

Activity starts with the inclusion of waste in the composter

Activity ends with the compost produced in home composter
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3821:Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Time period corresponds to the duration of the experiment
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Production of home compost refers to the situation in south west France at Pau
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The dataset represents the practice of home composting in heaps with only garden waste. The experiment was performed in the south of France starting March 2014, during 1 year.; The composter is stirred quartely. For the composting in heaps, there is no water addition to adjust moisture;. The online report (in French only) provides details on the experiment (composting practice, measurements and calculation of inventory data)
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data comes from on home composting in heaps with garden waste in France (Pau) during one year

exchanges.description: Experimental data: 272kg of garden waste produce 178kg of compost.

flow.name: biowaste, garden waste
flow.category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3821:Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste

flow.name: Water
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description:
This was derived as follows:
-Size of the composter=1,25m*1,3m=1,625m2
-The composter “digests” 271,97kg of biowaste in 1 year
-Land_occupation=1,625m2/271,97kg*1year=5,97e-3m2*year/kg biowaste
Experimental data. Five data from campaigns and one modeled data for one year
